marketNews.title: Prabowo's Nephew Inaugurated as Deputy Minister of Finance
marketNews.content: President Joko Widodo officially inaugurated Thomas Djiwandono, Prabowo Subianto's nephew and the treasurer of the Gerindra Party, as the deputy minister of finance on Thursday (18/7). The head of the Prabowo-Gibran Synchronization Task Force, Sufmi Dasco Ahmad, told Reuters that this inauguration was intended to smooth the transition of government from the administration of Mr. Jokowi to Mr. Prabowo. Based on a report from Harian Kompas, Thomas's career began as an intern journalist at Tempo Magazine in 1993 and at Indonesia Business Weekly in 1994. Additionally, Thomas worked as a financial analyst at Whetlock NatWest Securities, Hong Kong. He also helped his uncle, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, manage the Arsari Group by serving as Deputy CEO. Thomas is a graduate of Johns Hopkins University with a degree in International Relations and International Economics. Thomas was previously rumored to hold the next finance minister position after joining the Prabowo-Gibran Synchronization Task Force in the economic and financial sector. In a statement to Reuters, Thomas said that he would not serve as finance minister in the Prabowo-Gibran administration. Thomas mentioned that Prabowo is still considering professional candidates to fill the finance minister position. In February 2024, Bloomberg reported that Prabowo was considering a number of former bankers as candidates for finance minister. According to Bloomberg sources, some names considered included Minister of Health Budi Gunadi Sadikin, Deputy Minister of State-Owned Enterprises Kartika Wirjoatmodjo, Head of the OJK Supervisory Board Mahendra Siregar, and President Director of Bank Negara Indonesia Royke Tumilaar. Meanwhile, in April 2024, Reuters reported that former finance minister, Chatib Basri, was also one of the candidates considered by Prabowo. Key Takeaway: The selection of the finance minister for the next administration potentially influences foreign investor perception of Indonesia. This week, the fixed-income strategist for Asia at asset management firm Robeco, Philip McNicholas, told Bloomberg that the market is likely to impose a larger risk premium on Indonesian debt if the next finance minister is considered too subservient to Prabowo, instead of continuing to push for fiscal reform.

tickerNews.title: TPMA: Acquisition Valuation of BEST at 3.6x P/E
tickerNews.content: TPMA: Trans Power Marine announced that PT Bahtera Energi Samudra Tuah (BEST) - the company recently officially acquired - recorded a net profit of 14 million US dollars in FY23 and 2.1 million US dollars in 1Q24. This figure implies an acquisition valuation of BEST at 3.6x P/E for FY23, lower than our previous estimate at 3.8x. However, if using the annualized 1Q24 figure, the acquisition P/E rises to 6x due to weak performance in 1Q24. TPMA informed Stockbit that BEST's performance in 1Q24 was affected by force majeure at one of its main clients' mines, but this issue was resolved in 2Q24, so performance is expected to recover in the coming quarters.

tickerNews.title: ANTM Gold Production and Sales Volume 1H24
tickerNews.content: ANTM: Aneka Tambang recorded gold production volume of 439 kg (-26% YoY) during 1H24, equivalent to 45.8% of the 2024 target. Gold sales volume during 1H24 reached 15,969 kg (+18% YoY), equivalent to 42.8% of the 2024 target. For the ferronickel segment, ferronickel production volume reached 10,169 tons (-3% YoY) during 1H24, equivalent to 45.3% of the 2024 target. Meanwhile, ferronickel sales volume during 1H24 reached 6,778 tons (-36% YoY), equivalent to 30.2% of the 2024 target.

tickerNews.title: Astra Finance Targets IDR 2.8 Trillion Transactions at GIIAS 2024
tickerNews.content: ASII: Astra International's subsidiary, Astra Finance, is targeting transactions of IDR 2.8 trillion during the GIIAS 2024 event. Director in Charge of Astra Financial, Suparno Djasmin, stated that this target is relatively the same as the realization at GIIAS 2023.

tickerNews.title: WIFI Plans Rights Issue Up to ~4.7 Billion New Shares
tickerNews.content: WIFI: Solusi Sinergi Digital plans to conduct a rights issue of up to ~4.7 billion new shares with a dilution effect of up to 68.75%. The exercise price and ratio have not yet been announced. The proceeds are intended for the payment of the principal and interest of third-party loans, as well as working capital. This plan will be discussed at the EGM on August 21, 2024.

tickerNews.title: NCKL Announces Buyback Details and Timeline Consideration
tickerNews.content: NCKL: Trimegah Bangun Persada announced that the total estimated number of shares to be bought back ranges from 630 million to 1.26 billion shares. Previously, NCKL allocated funds of up to IDR 1 trillion for this corporate action, implying a buyback price of 794-1,587 rupiah per share. As of now, the company is still considering the best time to realize the buyback plan.

tickerNews.title: GEMS Coal Sales and Production Volumes 1H24
tickerNews.content: GEMS: Corporate Secretary of Golden Energy Mines, Sudin, stated that the company recorded coal sales volume of 25.3 million tons (+25.2% YoY) during 1H24. Meanwhile, coal production volume during 1H24 reached 24.8 million tons (+21.6% YoY), equivalent to 49.6% of the 2024 target.

tickerNews.title: Bloomberg Intelligence Report on IDX Special Monitoring Board Impact on Foreign Flows
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg Intelligence reported that the special monitoring board created by the IDX has the potential to accelerate the outflow of foreign funds from the Indonesian stock market. Analyst at Bloomberg Intelligence, Sufianti, stated that the inclusion of a stock in the special monitoring board will deter foreign investors due to less transparent transactions. This could burden the broader market return if the negative reaction impacts shares with significant weight. Sufianti noted that out of 38 stocks successfully removed from the special monitoring board, only 16 experienced price strengthening.

tickerNews.title: Prabowo-Gibran Economic Team Considers Cutting Free Lunch Budget Per Portion
tickerNews.content: Economist at Verdhana Sekuritas, Heriyanto Irawan, said that the Prabowo-Gibran economic team is considering options to cut the budget per portion for the free lunch program from IDR 15,000 to IDR 7,500-9,000. This consideration arose after he met with the Prabowo-Gibran economic team. This consideration is aimed at allowing the free lunch program to reach more recipients. Responding to this issue, Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, stated that the free lunch program will indeed be implemented flexibly.

tickerNews.title: BI Predicts Indonesia's Current Account Deficit in 2024 Below 0.9% of GDP
tickerNews.content: Bank Indonesia Governor, Perry Warjiyo, stated that BI predicts Indonesia's current account deficit for 2024 will range between 0.1-0.9% of GDP. Previously, Indonesia recorded a current account deficit of 2.16 billion US dollars or 0.6% of GDP in 1Q24 (vs. a surplus of 2.78 billion US dollars in 1Q23), marking a deficit for 4 consecutive quarters and being the largest deficit since 2Q23.

tickerNews.title: BYD Releases Battery Electric MPV M6 at GIIAS 2024
tickerNews.content: Chinese electric car manufacturer, BYD, released a battery electric multipurpose vehicle (BEV) with a 7-seater configuration at GIIAS 2024 on Wednesday (17/7). The car model, named M6, has a range of 420-531 km with a price range of 379-419 million rupiah. Besides the 7-seater variant, the BYD M6 is also available in a 6-seater variant priced at 429 million rupiah.

tickerNews.title: Elon Musk Committing Around $45 Million a Month to Pro-Trump Super PAC
tickerNews.content: Wall Street Journal reported that Elon Musk plans to donate $45 million per month to Donald Trump's campaign committee. The Wall Street Journal mentioned that Musk indicated his plan to donate in July 2024, although he is currently not registered as a campaign donor. The owner of the social media platform X previously committed to being neutral in the US election but subsequently publicly supported Trump after the former US presidential candidate experienced an assassination attempt during his campaign last week.

tickerNews.title: KIJA to Divest Cikarang Assets to Cover Debt, Including Loans from Bank Mandiri
tickerNews.content: President Director of Jababeka Industrial Estate (KIJA), Setyono Djuandi Darmono, stated that the company will divest assets in the form of land and others in Cikarang to cover the company's debt amounting to 280 million US dollars. The asset sale is aimed at paying off 100 million US dollars of debt, consisting of US dollar denominated bonds and loans from Bank Mandiri. The remaining debt of 180 million US dollars will be paid using a rights issue.
